item.title: 生态数据中心（EcoDataCenter）获得 6 亿欧元资金，用于扩建人工智能数据中心
item.description: 瑞典数字基础设施提供商 EcoDataCenter 周二表示，该公司已从德意志银行获得 6 亿欧元（约合 7.035 亿美元）的债务融资，用于扩建其人工智能数据中心。【原文：Swedish digital infrastructure provider EcoDataCenter has secured 600 million euros ($703.5 million) in debt financing from Deutsche Bank to expand its AI data centres, it said on Tuesday, as demand for high-performance computing surges amid the AI boom.】

item.title: 欧洲 政治动荡纷至沓来
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 美国 3 月份就业增长预计将大幅下调
item.description: 经济学家们预测，美国政府周二公布非农就业人数初步基准估计时，美国截至 3 月份的 12 个月就业人数可能会减少多达 100 万个工作岗位。【原文：The level of U.S. employment for the 12 months through March could be slashed by as many as one million jobs when the government publishes its preliminary nonfarm payrolls benchmark estimate on Tuesday, economists predicted.】

item.title: 高管警告：美国关税加剧石化行业的挑战
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）的一位高管周二在新加坡举行的APPEC会议上表示，美国的关税正在给本已面临挑战的石化行业带来越来越大的压力，并可能导致全球石化贸易下降15%。【原文：U.S. tariffs are increasingly pressuring the already challenged petrochemicals sector and could lead to a 15% drop in the global petrochemical trade, a TotalEnergies executive told the APPEC conference in Singapore on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储宽松前景压倒政治不确定性，股市上涨
item.description: 受美国最早将于下周降息的预期提振，亚洲股市周二上涨，尽管全球各地的政治动荡仍令货币和债券投资者惶恐不安。【原文：Asia stocks rose on Tuesday, buoyed by expectations of a U.S. rate cut as early as next week, even as political upheavals around the world kept currency and bond investors on edge.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 8 月商业环境改善，成本压力减轻
item.description: 8 月份，企业报告的利润和就业情况均有所改善，因此衡量澳大利亚商业状况的指标有所回升，而投入成本的增长速度则是 2021 年以来最慢的，这对通胀和利润率来说是一个有利的迹象。【原文：A measure of Australian business conditions picked up in August as firms reported better profits and employment, while input costs grew at the slowest pace since 2021 in a promising sign for inflation and margins.】

item.title: 就业前景黯淡加剧美联储减息可能性，美元跌至七周低点
item.description: 美元周二跌至近七周低点，因为投资者担心美国数据的修正可能会显示就业市场的状况比最初想象的更糟，从而为美联储更大幅度的降息提供支持。【原文：The dollar sank to an almost seven-week low on Tuesday as investors braced for U.S. data revisions that could show the jobs markets in worse shape than initially thought, shoring up the case for even deeper Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 日本日经指数因贸易和消费乐观而首次升至 44,000 点
item.description: 周二，随着市场对贸易和可能增加刺激性支出的乐观情绪蔓延，日本日经平均股价首次突破 44,000 点。【原文：Japan's Nikkei share average climbed past 44,000 for the first time on Tuesday as optimism over trade and potential increases in stimulus spending spread through the market.】

item.title: 石油因欧佩克+温和增产决定和俄罗斯供应困境而上涨
item.description: 在欧佩克+决定增产幅度低于市场参与者预期之后，周二油价上涨，而对俄罗斯可能受到新制裁导致供应紧张的担忧继续为油价提供支撑。【原文：Oil prices gained on Tuesday after OPEC+ decided to increase production by less than what market participants had anticipated, while concerns over tighter supply due to potential new sanctions on Russia continued to lend support.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者信心指数因经济忧虑下降 3.1
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于对经济前景的担忧盖过了家庭财务状况持续改善的影响，9月份澳大利亚消费者信心指数从3年半的高点回落。【原文：A measure of Australian consumer sentiment eased back from 3-1/2-year highs in September as concerns about the economic outlook overshadowed a continued improvement in family finances, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚主权财富基金规模突破 1,660 亿澳元，推动发达市场投资
item.description: 澳大利亚主权财富基金 "未来基金"（Future Fund）周二表示，由于在过去一年中增加了发达市场股票投资，减少了房地产和信贷风险，该基金的估值已达到 2,520 亿澳元（1,662.2 亿美元）。【原文：Australia's sovereign wealth fund, the Future Fund, said on Tuesday its valuation had reached A$252 billion ($166.22 billion) as it boosted its developed markets equity investments and reduced property and credit exposures in the past year.】

item.title: 美国机构启动程序，禁止被认为存在安全风险的中国实验室测试美国电子产品
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周一表示，以美国国家安全为由，已开始撤销对中国政府拥有或控制的七家测试实验室的认可。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission on Monday said it has begun proceedings to withdraw recognition from seven test labs owned or controlled by the Chinese government, citing U.S. national security concerns.】

item.title: 日本赤泽在 X 上表示，美国将在 9 月 16 日前削减对日本商品的关税
item.description: 日本关税谈判代表赤泽亮世周二在 X 上发帖称，美国将在 9 月 16 日前降低对日本商品（包括汽车和汽车零部件）征收的关税。【原文：U.S. tariffs on Japanese goods including cars and auto parts are set to be lowered by September 16, Japan's tariff negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said in an X post on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国服装零售商测试全价策略，富裕购物者持续消费
item.description: 包括李维斯（Levi Strauss）在内的一些服装零售商正在预告将推出更多全价产品，以测试尽管关税的影响令人担忧，但富裕的购物者愿意支付多少钱。【原文：A handful of apparel retailers including Levi Strauss are teasing more full-priced products, testing how much wealthier shoppers are willing to pay despite the sobering effect of tariffs.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，美国有超过 9 万用户的 Discord 出现故障
item.description: 据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 称，社交平台 Discord 周一有数万名用户宕机。【原文：Social platform Discord was down for tens of thousands of users on Monday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官称 T. Rowe 交易为投资者提供了购买退休产品的机会
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）首席执行官大卫-所罗门（David Solomon）周一表示，高盛对资产管理公司 T. Rowe Price 最多 10 亿美元的 "小额投资 "旨在为投资者提供更广泛的进入私人市场的机会。【原文：Goldman Sachs' "small investment" of up to $1 billion in asset manager T. Rowe Price is aimed at giving investors broader access to private markets, CEO David Solomon said on Monday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行将于 2026 年底裁员 3500 人
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周二表示，该公司计划在 2026 年 9 月前裁员 3500 人，并预计在 2025 财年下半年的业绩中计入 5.6 亿澳元（3.6898 亿美元）的重组费用。【原文：Australia's ANZ Group said on Tuesday it plans to cut 3,500 jobs by September 2026 and expects a A$560 million ($368.98 million) restructuring charge in its fiscal 2025 second-half results.】

item.title: 交易日：美联储逼近 "从容街"，政治沸腾
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: Nebius 与微软签订价值 174 亿美元的人工智能基础设施协议
item.description: Nebius 集团周一表示，它将为微软提供 GPU 基础设施容量，交易价值 174 亿美元，为期五年。【原文：Nebius Group said on Monday it will provide Microsoft with GPU infrastructure capacity, in a deal worth $17.4 billion, over a five-year term.】

item.title: 戴尔财务总监伊冯娜-麦吉尔辞职
item.description: 戴尔科技公司周一表示，公司首席财务官伊冯娜-麦吉尔（Yvonne McGill）将于 9 月 9 日辞职。【原文：Dell Technologies said on Monday its Chief Financial Officer Yvonne McGill would resign effective September 9.】

item.title: 福克斯公司称已终止与默多克家族信托相关的诉讼
item.description: 福克斯公司周一表示，该公司已就默多克家族信托的相关法律诉讼达成了共同解决方案，从而终止了所有诉讼。【原文：Fox Corp said on Monday that it has reached a mutual resolution on the legal proceedings related to the Murdoch Family Trust, resulting in the termination of all litigation.】

item.title: 英特尔宣布高层变动，产品总监离职
item.description: 英特尔周一宣布了一系列高层管理人员变动，其中包括公司产品主管米歇尔-霍尔索斯（Michelle Holthaus）的离职。【原文：Intel announced a series of high-level executive changes on Monday, including the departure of Michelle Holthaus, the company's products chief.】

item.title: 博雅银行预计第三季度投资银行业务收费将增长 10%至 15
item.description: 美国银行首席财务官阿拉斯泰尔-博思威克（Alastair Borthwick）周一表示，预计第三季度投资银行业务费用将同比增长 10%至 15%。【原文：Bank of America expects investment banking fees to increase 10% to 15% in the third quarter from a year earlier, Chief Financial Officer Alastair Borthwick said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院裁定 Trader Joe's 可以就商标问题起诉员工工会
item.description: 联邦上诉法院周一恢复了 Trader Joe's 的一项诉讼，该诉讼指控一家新成立的员工工会销售印有该杂货连锁店独特红色字体和标志的 T 恤衫、纽扣、马克杯和可重复使用手提袋，侵犯了其商标权。【原文：A federal appeals court on Monday revived a Trader Joe's lawsuit accusing a fledgling employee union of trademark infringement for selling t-shirts, buttons, mugs and reusable tote bags featuring the grocery chain's distinctive red typeface and logo.】

item.title: 分析师称康菲石油大幅裁员凸显资本约束需求
item.description: 康菲石油公司上周宣布将裁员至多 25%以削减成本，投资者和分析师表示，随着油价和收入的下降，康菲石油公司必须更加注重资本纪律和投资重点，以重新获得与同行竞争的能力。【原文：ConocoPhillips must sharpen its focus on capital discipline and investment priorities in order to regain its competitiveness against peers as oil prices and revenues fall, investors and analysts said, after the company announced last week it would lay off up to 25% of staff to cut costs.】

item.title: FAA 尚未就波音 737 MAX 的生产上限做出任何决定
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局局长周一表示，该局尚未就是否取消自2024年初开始实施的每月生产38架737 MAX飞机的计划，以及如何监督波音公司的生产做出任何决定。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration said on Monday the agency had not made any decisions on whether to lift the 38 plane per month 737 MAX production in place since early 2024, or how it oversees Boeing production.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称 Starboard 提名四人进入 BILL Holdings 董事会，其中包括合伙人 Peter Feld
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的人士表示，Starboard Value 已提名四名董事进入 BILL Holdings 董事会，其中包括其合伙人之一，因为这位激进投资者正在推动这家金融自动化软件公司提高股东回报。【原文：Starboard Value has nominated four directors, including one of its partners, to the board of BILL Holdings , said two people familiar with the matter, as the activist investor pushes the financial automation software company to improve shareholder returns.】

item.title: 特朗普提名的前驻日大使被任命为哥伦比亚广播公司新闻监察员
item.description: 派拉蒙天舞公司周一任命肯尼斯-温斯坦（Kenneth Weinstein）为哥伦比亚广播公司新闻监察员，这个新设立的职位旨在监督偏见和观众投诉。【原文：Paramount Skydance on Monday named Kenneth Weinstein as ombudsman for CBS News, a newly created role aimed at monitoring bias and audience complaints.】

item.title: Polestar 5 慕尼黑首发，但将跳过中国和美国
item.description: 瑞典汽车制造商 Polestar 周一在慕尼黑车展上发布了其大型旅行（GT）跑车 Polestar 5，但表示该车型最初不会在美国和中国销售。【原文：Swedish automaker Polestar unveiled its grand tourer (GT) sports car, the Polestar 5, at the Munich auto show on Monday, but said it won't sell the model initially in the United States and China.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，约有 16,000 名用户的 Google Meet 出现故障
item.description: 根据跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 的数据，Alphabet 旗下的 Google Meet 周一在美国有数千名用户遭遇宕机。【原文：Alphabet's Google Meet was down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Monday, according to tracking website Downdetector.com.】
